result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Syrrakos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 05/01/16 and each month thereafter or penalty of 6 days jail for non-payment.

DNA Surcharge is waived. 
However, defendant is to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J Syrrakos

defendant.name: Syrrakos, Christopher J

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Christopher J Syrrakos in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant appears pro-se. Case passed for defendant to speak to the State. Case re-called at 3:22 pm, Assistant District Attorney Pablo Galaviz now appears.  Atty Galaviz makes sentencing recomendations. Defendant makes statement. Court sentences the Defendant to the following. 

COUNT#1:

FINE: $ 284.50  ($50/month commencing (05/01/16) or serve 6 days jail, consecutive, as penalty for non payment of fine)
DNA surcharge waived  
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Christopher J Syrrakos in court.  Michael Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant states he has not yet received an offer from the state.  State speaks with Defendant off the record.  Defendant now, after speaking with the state, wishes to enter a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs colloquy with Defendant regarding his right to an attorney.  Defendant again states he wishes to proceed to plea today without counsel.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy with Defendant and finds him guilty of Count #1.  Domestic Abuse enhancer is stricken.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  Defendant requests a sentencing date so the state can determine if there is a restitution issue.  Court adjourns sentencing.    Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Cash bail previously posted to be refunded to poster.  Defendant is not to have any violent contact with any witnesses.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Christopher J Syrrakos in court.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
  Hearing scheduled for January 8, 2016 at 09:00 am.
